Body:
Chinese (Mandarin) translation of my question may be an example of the sentence structure that both English and Chinese share:

[Is there any] [sentence structure] (that) [English has but Chinese (Mandarin) does not]?
[有没有什么][句子结构][英语有但是汉语（普通话）没有]？
Title: Is there any sentence structure that English has but Chinese (Mandarin) does not?

LastEditedUser.AboutMe:
Travelling armchair linguist.

Never studied in an institution but read books and web with probably more breadth than depth.

Always on the road surviving in a strange foreign language, currently Mongolian and Mandarin Chinese.

And I collect dictionaries.
